channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Grenfell Tower, Where Fire Killed 72, Will Be Demolished, Families Say
item.description: Survivors and bereaved families’ groups said Britain’s deputy prime minister had told them that the site of the 2017 catastrophe would be dismantled.

item.title: What We Know About the Mass Shooting in Sweden
item.description: Swedish news outlets identified the shooter as Rickard Andersson, a 35-year-old from Orebro, the city where the shooting occurred, although the police...

item.title: Japan’s Prime Minister Will Seek to Preserve Status Quo at Summit With Trump
item.description: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is expected to cite his country’s increased investment in the U.S. and its regional security role when he meets Presiden...

item.title: U.S. Waives Aid Funding Freeze at Syrian Camp Holding ISIS Fighters
item.description: Upholding security at the camp is seen as critical to prevent a resurgence of the Islamic State. A contractor that trains the police there got a tempo...

item.title: Irv Gotti, Famed Hip-Hop Music Executive, Dies at 54
item.description: The producer helped launch the careers of Ja Rule and Ashanti with his label, Murder Inc. Records.

item.title: Trump’s Early Stumbles
item.description: On tariffs, Gaza and America’s reputation.

item.title: Israel Tells Military to Draft Plan for Gazans to Leave
item.description: The order by the Israeli defense minister comes after President Trump proposed a U.S. takeover of Gaza and said that all two million Palestinians in t...

item.title: Vermillion Cliffs Ventures launches with $13 million debut fund
item.description: Ashley Smith, previously of GitLab and GitHub, has launched Vermillion Cliffs Ventures with a debut $13 million fund, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: Uber CEO says the company is ‘well-positioned’ on autonomous vehicles—but gains are still a long way off
item.description: Chief executive Dara Khosrowshahi said Uber was "well-position" as the autonomous vehicle market heats up.

item.title: Honeywell will split into 3 companies, ending the run for one of the few remaining U.S. industrial conglomerates
item.description: The public announcement arrived about one month after Elliott Investment Management revealed a stake of more than $5 billion in the aerospace, automat...

item.title: Bank of England Cuts Interest Rates as British Economy Weakens
item.description: The central bank cut rates for the third time in about six months as it said growth had been weaker than expected.

item.title: Salesforce announces its first COFO—a powerful new exec role that combines CFO and COO
item.description: A seasoned executive and Salesforce board member, Robin Washington will start in the new role on March 21.

item.title: What We Know About the Mass Shooting in Sweden

item.title: Midnight Deadline for Federal Workers, and Anti-Trump Protests Across U.S.
item.description: Plus, the N.F.L.’s first fashion editor.

item.title: Bank of England gives hawkish warning as it cuts rates to 4.5%
item.description: The bank warned that inflation will rise “quite sharply” to peak at 3.7% later this year, up from 2.8% in the last forecast.
